name: Mantis Engine
text:
{2}: Mantis Engine gains flying until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{2}: Mantis Engine gains first strike until end of turn. (It deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)

editions.flavor: Tawnos left a legacy of animal designs in many of Urza's creations.

"It's a clever design. You should look closely at its gearing after it swallows your head."
—Jhoira, master artificer

name: Mantis Rider
text: Flying, vigilance, haste

editions.flavor: Mantis riders know their mounts owe them no allegiance. Even a mantis ridden for years would consume a rider who loses focus for only a moment.

name: Mantle of Leadership
text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Enchant creature
Whenever a creature enters the battlefield, enchanted creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

name: Mantle of Webs
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+3 and has reach. (It can block creatures with flying.)

editions.flavor: "Why does everything the Golgari touch end up sticky?"—Arrester Lavinia, Tenth Precinct

name: Map the Wastes
text: Search your library for a basic land card, put it onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle your library. Bolster 1. (Choose a creature with the least toughness among creatures you control and put a +1/+1 counter on it.)

name: Maralen of the Mornsong
text:
Players can't draw cards.
At the beginning of each player's draw step, that player loses 3 life, searches his or her library for a card, puts it into his or her hand, then shuffles his or her library.

editions.flavor: Maralen sent Veesa, Endry, and Iliona—the Vendilion clique—on the gravest of tasks.

name: Maralen of the Mornsong Avatar
text:
At the beginning of the game, you may pay any amount of life.
You can't draw cards.
At the beginning of your draw step, look at the top X cards of your library, where X is the amount of life paid with Maralen of the Mornsong Avatar. Put one of them into your hand, then shuffle your library.

editions.flavor: MOR Prize Avatar

name: Marang River Prowler
text:
Marang River Prowler can't block and can't be blocked.
You may cast Marang River Prowler from your graveyard as long as you control a black or green permanent.

editions.flavor: The currents of the Marang wash away both tracks and blood.

name: Marang River Skeleton
text:
{B}: Regenerate Marang River Skeleton.
Megamorph {3}{B} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its megamorph cost and put a +1/+1 counter on it.)

editions.flavor: The gurgling of the Marang conceals both footsteps and screams.

name: Marath, Will of the Wild
text:
Marath, Will of the Wild enters the battlefield with a number of +1/+1 counters on it equal to the amount of mana spent to cast it.
{X}, Remove X +1/+1 counters from Marath: Choose one —
• Put X +1/+1 counters on target creature. X can't be 0.
• Marath deals X damage to target creature or player. X can't be 0.
• Create an X/X green Elemental creature token. X can't be 0.

name: Marauding Knight
text:
Protection from white
Marauding Knight gets +1/+1 for each Plains your opponents control.

editions.flavor:
"They ride our trails as if they were designed to," said the guard.
"They were," replied Gerrard.

name: Marauding Maulhorn
text: Marauding Maulhorn attacks each combat if able unless you control a creature named Advocate of the Beast.

editions.flavor:
"It's not just you. Everyone makes it angry."
—Ardenoth, elvish nature advocate

name: Maraxus
text: Creatures you control get +1/+0.

editions.flavor: Too chaotic for even the other warlords of Keld, Maraxus has devoted himself to serving as a hired killer for the sinister Volrath. A man fond of his work, he's more than willing to put in those extra hours needed to perfect his craft.

name: Maraxus of Keld
text: Maraxus of Keld's power and toughness are each equal to the number of untapped artifacts, creatures, and lands you control.

editions.flavor:
"I have no master. I am chaos."
—Maraxus of Keld

name: Marble Chalice
text: {T}: You gain 1 life.

editions.flavor: The cup was a gift from the sphinx Tameron, who hoped that those who drank from it would live long enough to decrypt the sphinxes' wisdom.

name: Marble Diamond
text:
Marble Diamond enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {W} to your mana pool.

editions.set: Duel Decks Anthology, Divine vs. Demonic

name: Marble Priest
text:
All Walls able to block Marble Priest do so.
Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to Marble Priest by Walls.

name: Marble Titan
text: Creatures with power 3 or greater don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.

editions.flavor: It entered the temple with all the pomp and decorum of a rock hitting a goblin's skull.

"Strapping on nine hundred pounds of armor every morning would make any warrior cross."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight

name: Marchesa's Decree
text:
When Marchesa's Decree enters the battlefield, you become the monarch.
Whenever a creature attacks you or a planeswalker you control, that creature's controller loses 1 life.

editions.flavor:
"Those who seize power must have the means to hold it."
—Queen Marchesa

name: Marchesa's Emissary
text:
Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
Dethrone (Whenever this creature attacks the player with the most life or tied for most life, put a +1/+1 counter on it.)

editions.flavor: "The Black Rose doesn't tolerate weeds."

name: Marchesa's Infiltrator
text:
Dethrone (Whenever this creature attacks the player with the most life or tied for most life, put a +1/+1 counter on it.)
Whenever Marchesa's Infiltrator deals combat damage to a player, draw a card.

editions.flavor: "Secrets, like coins, are easy to steal."

name: Marchesa's Smuggler
text:
Dethrone (Whenever this creature attacks the player with the most life or tied for most life, put a +1/+1 counter on it.)
{1}{U}{R}: Target creature you control gains haste until end of turn and can't be blocked this turn.

editions.flavor: "Watch your head . . . and your back."

name: Marchesa, the Black Rose
text:
Dethrone (Whenever this creature attacks the player with the most life or tied for most life, put a +1/+1 counter on it.)
Other creatures you control have dethrone.
Whenever a creature you control with a +1/+1 counter on it dies, return that card to the battlefield under your control at the beginning of the next end step.

name: March from the Tomb
text: Return any number of target Ally creature cards with total converted mana cost 8 or less from your graveyard to the battlefield.

editions.flavor: They came from all walks of life, from every part of Zendikar, and they returned with one unifying cause.
They came from all walks of life, from every part of Zendikar, and they returned with one unifying cause.

name: March of Souls
text: Destroy all creatures. They can't be regenerated. For each creature destroyed this way, its controller creates a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying.

name: March of the Machines
text: Each noncreature artifact is an artifact creature with power and toughness each equal to its converted mana cost. (Equipment that's a creature can't equip a creature.)

name: March of the Returned
text: Return up to two target creature cards from your graveyard to your hand.

editions.flavor: The Returned have no memory of the Underworld or of their former lives. The golden masks they wear are the last gifts of the selves they left behind.

name: Mardu Ascendancy
text:
Whenever a nontoken creature you control attacks, create a 1/1 red Goblin creature token that's tapped and attacking.
Sacrifice Mardu Ascendancy: Creatures you control get +0/+3 until end of turn.

name: Mardu Banner
text:
{T}: Add {R}, {W}, or {B} to your mana pool.
{R}{W}{B}, {T}, Sacrifice Mardu Banner: Draw a card.

editions.flavor: Speed to strike, fury to smash.

name: Mardu Blazebringer
text: When Mardu Blazebringer attacks or blocks, sacrifice it at end of combat.

editions.flavor:
"Make sure he's pointed in the right direction before you light him. And don't let the goblins anywhere near the torch."
—Kerai Suddenblade, Mardu hordechief

name: Mardu Charm
text:
Choose one —
• Mardu Charm deals 4 damage to target creature.
• Create two 1/1 white Warrior creature tokens. They gain first strike until end of turn.
• Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose a noncreature, nonland card from it. That player discards that card.

name: Mardu Hateblade
text: {B}: Mardu Hateblade gains deathtouch until end of turn. (Any amount of damage it deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)

editions.flavor: "There may be little honor in my tactics, but there is no honor in losing."

name: Mardu Heart-Piercer
text: Raid — When Mardu Heart-Piercer enters the battlefield, if you attacked with a creature this turn, Mardu Heart-Piercer deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

editions.flavor: "Those who have never ridden before the wind do not know the true joy of war."
"Those who have never ridden before the wind do not know the true joy of war."

name: Mardu Hordechief
text: Raid — When Mardu Hordechief enters the battlefield, if you attacked with a creature this turn, create a 1/1 white Warrior creature token.

editions.flavor: The horde grows with each assault.

name: Mardu Roughrider
text: Whenever Mardu Roughrider attacks, target creature can't block this turn.

editions.flavor: The most ferocious saddlebrutes lead the assault, ramming through massed pikes and stout barricades as if they were paper and silk.

name: Mardu Runemark
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2.
Enchanted creature has first strike as long as you control a white or black permanent.

name: Mardu Scout
text: Dash {1}{R} (You may cast this spell for its dash cost. If you do, it gains haste, and it's returned from the battlefield to its owner's hand at the beginning of the next end step.)

editions.flavor: The Mardu all enjoy war, but only the goblins make a game of it.

name: Mardu Shadowspear
text:
Whenever Mardu Shadowspear attacks, each opponent loses 1 life.
Dash {1}{B} (You may cast this spell for its dash cost. If you do, it gains haste, and it's returned from the battlefield to its owner's hand at the beginning of the next end step.)

name: Mardu Skullhunter
text:
Mardu Skullhunter enters the battlefield tapped.
Raid — When Mardu Skullhunter enters the battlefield, if you attacked with a creature this turn, target opponent discards a card.

name: Mardu Strike Leader
text:
Whenever Mardu Strike Leader attacks, create a 2/1 black Warrior creature token.
Dash {3}{B} (You may cast this spell for its dash cost. If you do, it gains haste, and it's returned from the battlefield to its owner's hand at the beginning of the next end step.)

name: Mardu Warshrieker
text: Raid — When Mardu Warshrieker enters the battlefield, if you attacked with a creature this turn, add {R}{W}{B} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor:
"No body can contain so much fury. It reminds me of another battle, long past."
—Sarkhan Vol

name: Mardu Woe-Reaper
text: Whenever Mardu Woe-Reaper or another Warrior enters the battlefield under your control, you may exile target creature card from a graveyard. If you do, you gain 1 life.

editions.flavor: "Those who died in battle deserve their rest."

name: Marhault Elsdragon
text: Rampage 1 (Whenever this creature becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each creature blocking it beyond the first.)

editions.flavor: Marhault follows a strict philosophy, never letting emotions cloud his thoughts. No chance observer could imagine the rage in his heart.
Marhault Elsdragon follows a strict philosophy, never letting emotions cloud his thoughts. No chance observer could imagine the rage in his heart.
Marhault Elsdragon follows a strict philosophy, never letting emotions cloud his thoughts. No chance observer could imagine the rage in his heart.

name: Marionette Master
text:
Fabricate 3 (When this creature enters the battlefield, put three +1/+1 counters on it or create three 1/1 colorless Servo artifact creature tokens.)
Whenever an artifact you control is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, target opponent loses life equal to Marionette Master's power.

name: Marisi's Twinclaws
text: Double strike

editions.set: Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas
editions.flavor:
"Looks like we're completely outnumbered."
"Lucky for us. I thought we'd be bored."

"Looks like we're completely outnumbered."
"Lucky for us. I thought we'd be bored."

"Looks like we're completely outnumbered."
"Lucky for us. I thought we'd be bored."
Once common in the Kapsho Seas, merfolk were hunted almost to extinction. They survived those dark days and emerged calculating and determined to endure.
To stand as a guardian of the sea, one must possess the resolve of a mounting wave.

name: Marjhan
text:
Marjhan doesn't untap during your untap step.
{U}{U}, Sacrifice a creature: Untap Marjhan. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.
Marjhan can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
{U}{U}: Marjhan gets -1/-0 until end of turn and deals 1 damage to target attacking creature without flying.
When you control no Islands, sacrifice Marjhan.

name: Marked by Honor
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has vigilance. (Attacking doesn't cause it to tap.)

editions.flavor: Stand your post for duty. Stand your ground for honor.
Stand your post for duty. Stand your ground for honor.

name: Marker Beetles
text:
When Marker Beetles dies, target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
{2}, Sacrifice Marker Beetles: Draw a card.

editions.flavor: In case of emergency, crush bug.

name: Market Festival
text:
Enchant land
Whenever enchanted land is tapped for mana, its controller adds two mana in any combination of colors to his or her mana pool (in addition to the mana the land produces).

editions.flavor: Commerce is always the basis for peace.

name: Mark for Death
text: Target creature an opponent controls blocks this turn if able. Untap that creature. Other creatures that player controls can't block this turn.

editions.flavor: Everyone roots for the little guy, but nobody bets on him.

name: Mark of Asylum
text: Prevent all noncombat damage that would be dealt to creatures you control.

editions.flavor: A paragon of honor, Galo Aher fell to a blast of fire. The Order of the White Orchid was so saddened that they forged a new sigil in his likeness.

name: Mark of Eviction
text:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of your upkeep, return enchanted creature and all Auras attached to that creature to their owners' hands.

editions.flavor: Tharashk the Bold suddenly wasn't himself. Or anyone else, for that matter.

name: Mark of Fury
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has haste.
At the beginning of the end step, return Mark of Fury to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor: Many Keldon warriors bear the mark of intentional insanity.

name: Mark of Mutiny
text: Gain control of target creature until end of turn. Put a +1/+1 counter on it and untap it. That creature gains haste until end of turn. (It can attack and {T} this turn.)

editions.flavor: The flame of anger is hard to douse once lit.
The flame of anger is hard to douse once lit.
The flame of anger is hard to douse once lit.
The flame of anger is hard to douse once lit.

name: Mark of Sakiko
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has "Whenever this creature deals combat damage to a player, add that much {G} to your mana pool. Until end of turn, this mana doesn't empty from your mana pool as steps and phases end."

name: Mark of the Oni
text:
Enchant creature
You control enchanted creature.
At the beginning of the end step, if you control no Demons, sacrifice Mark of the Oni.

editions.flavor:
"As more oni walked Kamigawa, more darkness infested its inhabitants' souls."
—The History of Kamigawa

name: Mark of the Vampire
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has lifelink. (Damage dealt by the creature also causes its controller to gain that much life.)

editions.flavor:
"My ‘condition' is a trial. The weak are consumed by it. The strong transcend it."
—Sorin Markov

"My ‘condition' is a trial. The weak are consumed by it. The strong transcend it."
—Sorin Markov

"My ‘condition' is a trial. The weak are consumed by it. The strong transcend it."
—Sorin Markov

name: Markov Blademaster
text:
Double strike
Whenever Markov Blademaster deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.

editions.flavor: "Mortals practice swordplay for a few decades at best. How can they ever attain the exquisite mastery that eternity has to offer?"

name: Markov Crusader
text:
Lifelink
Markov Crusader has haste as long as you control another Vampire.

editions.flavor: The surviving members of the Markov bloodline drove through a crush of horrors to reclaim their ancestral home.

name: Markov Dreadknight
text:
Flying
{2}{B}, Discard a card: Put two +1/+1 counters on Markov Dreadknight.

editions.flavor: The destruction of Markov Manor made the surviving members of the bloodline more dangerous.

name: Markov Patrician
text: Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)

editions.flavor: Vampires of the Markov bloodline pride themselves on their exquisite taste in fashion, art, and "wine of the vein."
". . . and for that I shall be eternally grateful."

name: Markov Warlord
text:
Haste
When Markov Warlord enters the battlefield, up to two target creatures can't block this turn.

editions.flavor: "What use is a stake or holy symbol in the hands of a coward?"

name: Maro
text: Maro's power and toughness are each equal to the number of cards in your hand.

editions.flavor: No two see the same Maro.
No two see the same Maro.
No two see the same Maro.

name: Maro Avatar
text: Tap an untapped creature you control, Discard a card: Target creature you control gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the number of cards in your hand.

editions.flavor: 9ED Prize Avatar

name: Marrow Bats
text:
Flying
Pay 4 life: Regenerate Marrow Bats.

editions.flavor:
"No matter how far we push into Stensia, undeath will always remain in these lands."
—Terhold, archmage of Drunau

"No matter how far we push into Stensia, undeath will always remain in these lands."
—Terhold, archmage of Drunau

name: Marrow Chomper
text:
Devour 2 (As this enters the battlefield, you may sacrifice any number of creatures. This creature enters the battlefield with twice that many +1/+1 counters on it.)
When Marrow Chomper enters the battlefield, you gain 2 life for each creature it devoured.

name: Marrow-Gnawer
text:
Rat creatures have fear. (They can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
{T}, Sacrifice a Rat: Create X 1/1 black Rat creature tokens, where X is the number of Rats you control.

editions.flavor: Marrow-Gnawer united three nezumi gangs when he slew their leaders in a single night. Now they call him their first lord.

name: Marrow Shards
text:
({W/P} can be paid with either {W} or 2 life.)
Marrow Shards deals 1 damage to each attacking creature.

editions.flavor:
"We are a single entity. Dissenters must be sutured into the Orthodoxy."
—Elesh Norn, Grand Cenobite

name: Marshaling Cry
text:
Creatures you control get +1/+1 and gain vigilance until end of turn.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
Flashback {3}{W} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

name: Marshaling the Troops
text: Tap any number of untapped creatures you control. You gain 4 life for each creature tapped this way.

name: Marshal's Anthem
text:
Multikicker {1}{W} (You may pay an additional {1}{W} any number of times as you cast this spell.)
Creatures you control get +1/+1.
When Marshal's Anthem enters the battlefield, return up to X target creature cards from your graveyard to the battlefield, where X is the number of times Marshal's Anthem was kicked.

name: Marsh Boa
text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)

editions.flavor: Though a powerful constrictor, it prefers simply to drown its prey.

name: Marsh Casualties
text:
Kicker {3} (You may pay an additional {3} as you cast this spell.)
Creatures target player controls get -1/-1 until end of turn. If Marsh Casualties was kicked, those creatures get -2/-2 until end of turn instead.

name: Marsh Crocodile
text:
When Marsh Crocodile enters the battlefield, return a blue or black creature you control to its owner's hand.
When Marsh Crocodile enters the battlefield, each player discards a card.

name: Marshdrinker Giant
text: When Marshdrinker Giant enters the battlefield, destroy target Island or Swamp an opponent controls.

editions.flavor: When giants rise from their long slumbers, they rarely remember how fragile the waking world can be.

name: Marsh Flats
text: {T}, Pay 1 life, Sacrifice Marsh Flats: Search your library for a Plains or Swamp card and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

name: Marsh Flitter
text:
Flying
When Marsh Flitter enters the battlefield, create two 1/1 black Goblin Rogue creature tokens.
Sacrifice a Goblin: Marsh Flitter has base power and toughness 3/3 until end of turn.

name: Marsh Gas
text: All creatures get -2/-0 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: "Comes right outta th' ground. If ya can smell it, it's too late." —Keevy Bogsbury

"Comes right outta th' ground. If ya can smell it, it's too late."
—Keevy Bogsbury

name: Marsh Goblins
text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)

editions.flavor: Even the other Goblin races shun the Marsh Goblins, thanks to certain unwholesome customs they practice.

name: Marsh Hulk
text: Megamorph {6}{B} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its megamorph cost and put a +1/+1 counter on it.)

editions.flavor: Now vengeance is his sole purpose.

name: Marsh Lurker
text: Sacrifice a Swamp: Marsh Lurker gains fear until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)

editions.flavor: From the mists it rises, into the mists it retreats; through the mists it walks, fearless and unseen.

name: Marshmist Titan
text: Marshmist Titan costs {X} less to cast, where X is your devotion to black. (Each {B} in the mana costs of permanents you control counts toward your devotion to black.)

editions.flavor: A favorite of Erebos, for it has sent many to the Underworld.

name: Marsh Threader
text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)

editions.flavor: "Give me a sturdy rope over the advice of any so-called expert. I can thread the dark wilds better than anyone."

name: Marsh Viper
text: Whenever Marsh Viper deals damage to a player, that player gets two poison counters. (A player with ten or more poison counters loses the game.)

editions.flavor: "All we had left were their black and bloated bodies." —Maeveen O'Donagh, Memoirs of a Soldier

"And the seraphs sob at vermin fangs
In human gore imbued."
—Edgar Allan Poe, "The Conqueror Wurm"
"All we had left were their black and bloated bodies." —Maeveen O'Donagh, Memoirs of a Soldier

name: Martial Coup
text: Create X 1/1 white Soldier creature tokens. If X is 5 or more, destroy all other creatures.

editions.flavor: Their war forgotten, the nations of Bant stood united in the face of a common threat.
Their war forgotten, the nations of Bant stood united in the face of a common threat.
Their war forgotten, the nations of Bant stood united in the face of a common threat.

name: Martial Glory
text:
Target creature gets +3/+0 until end of turn.
Target creature gets +0/+3 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"Yes, Boros tactics are unparalleled. But when your comrades are dying around you, inner strength must carry the day."
—Gideon Jura, to Aurelia

name: Martial Law
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, detain target creature an opponent controls. (Until your next turn, that creature can't attack or block and its activated abilities can't be activated.)

editions.flavor:
"The good of society matters much more than the inconvenience of a few."
—Agmand Sarv, Azorius hussar

name: Márton Stromgald
text:
Whenever Márton Stromgald attacks, other attacking creatures get +1/+1 until end of turn for each attacking creature other than Márton Stromgald.
Whenever Márton Stromgald blocks, other blocking creatures get +1/+1 until end of turn for each blocking creature other than Márton Stromgald.

name: Martyrdom
text: Until end of turn, target creature you control gains "{0}: The next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn is dealt to this creature instead." Only you may activate this ability.

editions.flavor:
"Martyrs are cheaper than mercenaries, and a far better investment."
—General Varchild

"The only true immortality is in dying for a cause."
—Halvor Arensson, Kjeldoran Priest

name: Martyred Rusalka
text: {W}, Sacrifice a creature: Target creature can't attack this turn.

editions.flavor: Rakdos cultists hanged her for sport in the township square. Her ghost now stands vigil at what has become known as the Tree of Weeping.

name: Martyr of Ashes
text: {2}, Reveal X red cards from your hand, Sacrifice Martyr of Ashes: Martyr of Ashes deals X damage to each creature without flying.

editions.flavor: She turns ash into flame and burns enemies to ash.

name: Martyr of Bones
text: {1}, Reveal X black cards from your hand, Sacrifice Martyr of Bones: Exile up to X target cards from a single graveyard.

editions.flavor: Puppeteered by Heidar's icy hand, they were sacrificed to the Frost Marsh to raise Haakon's army.

name: Martyr of Frost
text: {2}, Reveal X blue cards from your hand, Sacrifice Martyr of Frost: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {X}.

editions.flavor:
"Do not call the Balduvians barbaric. Their magic is as potent as it is primal."
—Zur the Enchanter

"Do not call the Balduvians barbaric. Their magic is as potent as it is primal."

—Zur the Enchanter

name: Martyr of Sands
text: {1}, Reveal X white cards from your hand, Sacrifice Martyr of Sands: You gain three times X life.

editions.flavor: "Only in our vulnerability is there true power, and that power is life itself."

name: Martyr of Spores
text: {1}, Reveal X green cards from your hand, Sacrifice Martyr of Spores: Target creature gets +X/+X until end of turn.

editions.flavor: "Weep not for me. I will rise with the spring's new growth."

name: Martyr's Bond
text: Whenever Martyr's Bond or another nonland permanent you control is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, each opponent sacrifices a permanent that shares a card type with it.

editions.flavor:
"Our lives are connected by divine law. The truth of this will be made evident in time."
—Zedruu the Greathearted

name: Martyr's Cause
text: Sacrifice a creature: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to target creature or player this turn, prevent that damage.

editions.flavor: Dying is a soldier's talent.

name: Martyr's Cry
text: Exile all white creatures. For each creature exiled this way, its controller draws a card.

editions.flavor: "It is only fitting that one such as I should die in pursuit of knowledge." —Vervamon the Elder
